## useR! 2019

- Location: Toulouse, France
- Dates: July 9th(Tue) - 12th(Fr) 
- Schedule:
  - Tuesday: tutorials
  - Wednesday: regular talks (**Riccardo**)
  - Thursday: lightning and regular talks (**Nikki**)
  - Friday: lightning and regular talks

## Tutorials - Morning session 

- Rasmus Bååth - Get up to speed with Bayesian data analysis
- Jo-Fai Chow - Automatic and Explainable Machine Learning with H2O (**Nikki**)
- Di Cook - Visualizing High-Dimensional Data
- Dirk Eddelbuettel - Extending R with C++
- Colin Fay - Hacking RStudio: Advanced Use of your Favorite IDE
- Anqi Fu - CVXR: Disciplined Convex Optimization
- Colin Gillespie - Getting the most out of Git (**Riccardo**)
- Jim, Hadley, Jenny - Package Development (**Francesca**)
- Heather Turner - Generalized Nonlinear Models

## Tutorial - Automatic and Explainable Machine Learning with H2O

[Material](https://github.com/woobe/useR2019_h2o_tutorial) 

**Impression:**

Nikki: a bit too much advertising, however useful to get a first hands on practice on ML.

## Tutorial - Package Development  

[Material](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1rR_owo4_B8nwAwa3iX5Fvgr1QAXk8fqP) including modifications done during the workshop.

**References:**

* https://github.com/jennybc/pkg-dev-tutorial
* https://principles.tidyverse.org/

**Impression:**

Francesca: nothing more than what you can find online. Not useful to learn how to teach the topic.

**Take home message:**

Beware that some functionalities are now part of `usethis` package.

## Keynote1 - R for better science in less time  

**Julia Stewart Lowndes** (@juliesquid)
Marine Data scientist and Mozilla Fellow. Founder of RLadies Santa Barbara.

About her experience in building an analytic workflow with R that emphasizes communication and training for better science. 

**Impressions:**

Francesca: inspirational talk on collaboration and open source!
Nikki: if I could rolled up my eyes more than humanely possible, I would have.

## Francesca attended "Shiny & web": 

* Victor Perrier - [Our journey with Shiny : some packages to enhance your applications](https://user2019.r-project.org/static/pres/lt257594.pdf)
R packages
    - [shinyWidgets](https://dreamrs.github.io/shinyWidgets/): we use it in Oasis

    - [shinylogs](https://github.com/dreamRs/shinylogs): Track stuff happening on the browser side
    - [shinymanager](https://github.com/datastorm-open/shinymanager): Simple and secure authentication mechanism

## Keynote6 - 'AI for Good' in the R and Python ecosystems 

**Julien Cornebise** 
Professor at Johannes Kepler Universität Linz (Austria)

Projects joint with Amnesty International:

* detecting burned villages on satellite imagery in conflict zones
* studying abuse against women on Twitter

Tools and communities should not be rivals but instead complement each other

**References**

Talk [video](https://youtu.be/G2SgOQv3PEM?t=3384)
